skill.name: hybrid-cloud-networking
skill.description: Configure secure, high-performance connectivity between on-premises infrastructure and cloud platforms using VPN and dedicated connections. Use when building hybrid cloud architectures, connecting data centers to cloud, or implementing secure cross-premises networking.
skill.summary: Configure secure, high-performance connectivity between on-premises infrastructure and cloud platfor...
skill.author: wshobson

security_audit.summary: The skill is documentation only and contains no executable code or scripts. No file, environment, or network access is present. Risk appears minimal.

content.value_statement: Hybrid networking choices are complex and affect reliability and security. This skill provides clear guidance on VPN, dedicated links, routing, and monitoring for hybrid deployments.
actual_capabilities: Explain AWS, Azure, and GCP hybrid connectivity options and tradeoffs
Provide Terraform example snippets for VPN gateways and connections
Describe hub-and-spoke, multi-region, and multi-cloud patterns
Outline BGP routing configuration and route propagation guidance
List security best practices for hybrid links
List monitoring metrics and troubleshooting commands for VPN
limitations: Does not provision infrastructure or run cloud commands
Does not validate live configurations, performance, or SLAs
Requires existing cloud accounts and on-premises network details
Does not provide provider-specific pricing or contracts

use_cases.title: Plan hybrid connectivity
use_cases.description: Select VPN or dedicated links and choose routing patterns for a new hybrid design.

use_cases.title: Harden hybrid links
use_cases.description: Apply redundancy, BGP, and security controls for on-premises to cloud connections.

use_cases.title: Support compliance reviews
use_cases.description: Map required controls to hybrid connectivity options and monitoring evidence.

prompt_templates.title: Choose connectivity
prompt_templates.scenario: Small data center to one cloud
prompt_templates.prompt: Recommend VPN or dedicated connectivity for a small on-premises data center to AWS and explain the tradeoffs and minimum redundancy.

prompt_templates.title: Design hub and spoke
prompt_templates.prompt: Design a hub and spoke hybrid network using AWS Transit Gateway or Azure vWAN and list key routing steps.

prompt_templates.title: Plan multi cloud links
prompt_templates.prompt: Outline a multi-cloud hybrid design using Direct Connect, ExpressRoute, and Interconnect with redundancy and route filtering.

prompt_templates.title: Troubleshoot VPN
prompt_templates.prompt: Provide a step by step checklist to diagnose VPN tunnel instability and BGP session drops, including metrics and CLI commands.

output_examples.input: Design a resilient hybrid link between on-premises and AWS in two regions
output: Use two Direct Connect circuits per region with diverse paths
Add site-to-site VPN as backup in each region
Enable BGP with route filters for on-premises prefixes
Monitor tunnel status, latency, and BGP session health

best_practices: Use redundant tunnels or circuits with BGP failover
Prefer private connectivity for sensitive workloads
Monitor routing changes and tunnel health metrics
anti_patterns: Relying on a single VPN tunnel for production traffic
Advertising overly broad routes without filtering
Skipping monitoring of BGP session health

faq.question: Is this compatible with AWS, Azure, and GCP?
faq.answer: Yes. It covers VPN and dedicated connectivity options for all three providers.

faq.question: What are the limits of the guidance?
faq.answer: It provides patterns and examples but does not validate live configurations or SLAs.

faq.question: Can it integrate with Terraform workflows?
faq.answer: Yes. It includes Terraform examples you can adapt to your modules.

faq.question: Does it access my credentials or data?
faq.answer: No. It only provides guidance and does not read local files or tokens.

faq.question: How do I troubleshoot VPN instability?
faq.answer: Check tunnel status, BGP sessions, latency, and route propagation settings.

faq.question: How does it compare to generic networking advice?
faq.answer: It focuses on hybrid cloud providers and specific connectivity services.
